questions.question: What does WICOR stand for?

choices.answer: Writing Inquiry Collaboration Organization Reading
Work Intelligence Creative Order Rigor
Writing Inquiry Creativity Organization Rigor
Wonder Intuitive Collaborate Order Read

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of W in WICOR?

choices.answer: Taking notes
Discussing a question with your group.
Reading a book
Walking around the room

questions.question: What must be done before the a student presents his/her tutorial?

choices.answer: Take notes, complete TRF, and have tutor check it.
Meet group, share 30 sec. speech, check for understanding.
Complete reflection and read feedback.
There's nothing to do before the tutorial.

questions.question: Where does the initial question on the TRF come from?

choices.answer: You make it up.
From the internet
From homework
From the book, quiz, test, notes, or homework

questions.question: What are the requirements for your point of confusion?

choices.answer: It's the same as your initial question.
It needs to be from your school work and use key vocab.
It must be the specific spot you got stuck & use key vocab.
It can be anything if it is a question and has key vocab.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a good point of confusion?

choices.answer: How do I get the answer?
How do I find the radius of a triangle?
What's the difference between a topic sentence & main idea?
How do I get the variable alone after I have it on one side?

questions.question: If your TRF is late, how many points do you lose and what's the highest grade you can get?

choices.answer: Lose 3 points and could still get an A
Lose 3 points and could get a B
Lose 6 points and could get a C
Lose 6 points and could get a D

questions.question: What's the first thing I should do when giving my Presenter Speech?

choices.answer: Share what I know about my question.
Share my steps.
Ask my group to help me.
Share my specific question/POC.

questions.question: During the tutorial, what do I have to remember?

choices.answer: If I know the answer, I can tell the presenter.
I take notes while the tutor asks the questions.
I ask questions but give answers if I don't have a question.
I ask questions only and I never give the answer.

questions.question: What do the 3 column notes consist of?

choices.answer: The POC, Notes, and Steps.
The Initial question, Notes, and Steps.
We don't take any notes.
The POC, Notes, and the Final answer.

questions.question: What's the most important thing to remember when filling out the reflection?

choices.answer: Write complete sentences.
Make up the answers.
Be specific and explain what you mean.
Write the same thing over and over again.

questions.question: What are your learning logs about?

choices.answer: What I did in all my classes.
What I learned in all my classes.
The homework I had in my classes.
Whatever I want.

questions.question: What does AVID stand for?

choices.answer: Achievement Via Intelligent Data
Academic Valor In Determination
Advancement Via Individual Determination
Advancement Via Intelligent Dogs

questions.question: Which of the following an example of I in the WICOR process?

choices.answer: Writing notes
Asking questions
Helping other students
Reading over the notes

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an AVID Role Model?

choices.answer: Shouting out during class.
Arguing with the teacher or the sub.
Not being prepared for class.
Getting work done and completed on time.

questions.question: The AVID class is geared to prepare you for certain things. What are they?

choices.answer: College and a career
Just college
Just a career
AVID doesn't prepare you for anything.

questions.question: There are two major requirements for the AVID program. What are they?

choices.answer: Straight A's and No SAC's
No D's and F's and Follow the school rules.
All A's and B's and Following the rules
Be good and do your work.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a reason it's important to fill out your planner every week?

choices.answer: Students will know what is happening in class every day.
Students know what their homework is and when it is due.
Students will know what they missed when absent.
Students will waste time writing down too many things.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of the C in the WICOR process?

choices.answer: Writing an essay
Asking questions about the notes
Students helping each other
Reading an article and answering questions

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of the O in the WICOR process?

choices.answer: Using the Cornell note format
Reading a book silently
Working as a team
Writing weekly summaries

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of the R in the WICOR process?

choices.answer: Writing leveled questions
Working with a partner on a project
Reading the question and circling key words
Having a table of contents in your notebook

questions.question: What do you need to include in your point of confusion?

choices.answer: A question mark
Key vocabulary
Where the question came from
The initial question

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of an AVID Role Model

choices.answer: Raising your hand and waiting to be called on.
Coming to class prepared with: planner, pencils, & notebook
Completing homework on time and turning it in.
Being late for class and turning assignments in late

questions.question: Which of the following is the best point of confusion?

choices.answer: How do I find the answer?
How do I solve this problem?
Once I move all variables to one side, what's my next step?
What's the next step in my math problem?

questions.question: If you used simile & metaphor as your key vocabulary, which Point Of Confusion is correct?

choices.answer: How do I know if a phrase is a simile or a metaphor?
What kind of figurative language is being used?
What's the difference between simile and personification?
What kind of fig. lang. is, "you're as sweet as candy"?
